links.response: To call an agent, make sure that you've used the braided tether cord to connect the Horizon glasses to the Horizon phone. Then, you can either double press on the call button to call an agent, or hold down on the call button and say, "call an agent." Would you like me to repeat that or continue to my last tip?
Sorry, I didn't get that. Would you like me to repeat that or continue?

Sure. The screen on the phone you're holding is disabled to create a voice first experience. To talk to me, you can hold down on the call button located below the screen, and say things like, "how do I use Horizon?" or "what can you do?" Would you like me to repeat that or continue?

links.response: Failure is success if we learn from it.
Never let schooling interfere with your education.
Take care of your body. It's the only place you have to live.
quote,, This too shall pass,, end quote,, This is an ancient poet adage reflecting on the ephemeral nature of the human condition.
Bump dots are tactile stickers that can be placed on touchscreen interfaces like a refrigerator or microwave, as long as the screen doesn't dynamically change the location of buttons.
Your pharmacist can place braille labels on any medication, or if you prefer you can give the pharmacist bump dots to put on your medicine bottles according to your own labeling system.
Never take a medicine that you aren't 100% sure of it's origin and usage or dosage. When in doubt call an Aira agent. Many medicine bottle labels can only be read accurately by a human.
Your pharmacist can place braille labels on any medication, or if you prefer you can give the pharmacist bump dots to put on your medicine bottles according to your own labeling system.

If you have strong mobility skills, taking the stairs rather than the elevator at every opportunity can improve your long term health. If you prefer exercise machines you can play an interesting podcast or have Chloe read you a book while you work out.

Chloe now supports enabling or disabling Wi-Fi on the fly.
Chloe now supports enabling or disabling Wi-Fi on the fly.

links.command: what is new in this release|update
links.response: Chloe now supports enabling or disabling Wi-Fi on the fly.
Chloe now supports enabling or disabling Wi-Fi on the fly.

version 27 adds 1 feature and 4 bug fixes. Feature 1, MQTT remote agent call initiation. Bug fix 1, remove deprecated calls of `onSpeechError`. Bug fix 2 Gradle build script cleanup and library version correction. Bug fix 3, Open source Android Speech library compiled to AAR and removed from source tree. Bug fix 4, build documentation and notes added.
version 34 adds Network connectivity bug fixes and templating language for Chloe utterance building.
You can now ask Chloe to record a note, but she isn't yet able to search or list those notes. Also, bluetooth connection dialog and agent dashboard connectivity is now more robust.
More robust connection to the agent

on version 37 I can now share your signal strength status. You can say, How is my connectivity? or What network am I connected to? Additionally, Aira has made Horizon connectivity improvements in this release, and will continue to make progress on the bluetooth and document reading features. Thank you for tuning in today!
Improved robustness of the app, automatic restarting on unexpected errors.
Added Samsung KNOX support, text recognition with the phone's camera. Chloe now supports proximity-based reading.
Chloe now supports enabling or disabling Wi-Fi on the fly.
